DataElement.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group Disease Progression Medical Imaging Measurable Disease Documented Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether RECIST disease progression in existing measurable disease sites was determined by radiographic imaging.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group Disease Progression Medical Imaging Measurable Disease Documented
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the growth of an existing measurable tumor as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Group and documented by imaging technology, the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Disease Progression
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Documented; furnished with or supported by documents.

Concepts.definition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
